metadata.title: CVE-2015-1322 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the Ubuntu network-manager package forUbuntu (vivid) before 0.9.10.0-4ubuntu15.1, Ubuntu 14.10 before0.9.8.8-0ubuntu28.1, and Ubuntu 14.04 LTS before 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1 allowslocal users to change the modem device configuration or read arbitraryfiles via a .. (dot dot) in the file name in a request to read modem devicecontexts (com.canonical.NMOfono.ReadImsiContexts).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-networkmanager-1.0 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
libnm-glib-vpn1 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
libnm-glib4 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
libnm-util2 - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
network-manager - 0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: network-manager package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.8.8-0ubuntu7.1').
